links.title: Qualcomm's 5G phone push is a quest to destabilize Apple and Intel
links.description: The world's largest mobile chipmaker is using 5G phones to go after Intel and Apple -- hard. That was clear after Qualcomm's tech summit in Hawaii this week. One after the other, executives compared the speed and battery gains of Qualcomm's processors that will power and 4G and to Intel and Apple's competing models.

messages.body: This Is Why The Stock Market Sell-off May Be Overdone $spy $jnj $amzn $googl $aapl $goog $fb  https://mottcapitalmanagement.com/this-is-why-the-stock-market-sell-off-may-be-overdone/

links.title: This Is Why The Stock Market Sell-off May Be Overdone
links.description: The market continues to be extraordinarily volatile, but earnings for 2019 are still expected to be robust and grow around 10% according to the latest data from Dow Jones S&P Indices. The most recent revisions as of December 6 suggests that earnings will increase next year to $174.01 per share up from $157.52 per shares in 2018.

$AAPL  
What Broadcom's Results Say About Apple's iPhone Units

https://seekingalpha.com/article/4227064-broadcoms-results-say-apples-iphone-units

links.title: What Broadcom's Results Say About Apple's iPhone Units
links.description: Broadcom( AVGO) reported better than expected quarterly results on Dec. 6 after the close. But more important the company saw better than expected wireless business growth. It should be a positive read through to Apple ( AAPL) and suggests that perhaps things at Apple aren't as dire as some have feared.

messages.body: $AAPL $AMZN $WMT  https://www.cnbc.com/2018/12/09/goldman-sachs-consumer-spending-to-keep-hopes-on-economy-alive.html?__source=iosappshare%7Ccom.stocktwits.StockTwits.STShareExtension

links.title: Goldman Sachs: As long as consumers keep shopping, there's hope for the economy
links.description: Goldman's relatively upbeat assessment came against a backdrop of a market buffeted by internal and external risks - most notably the U.S.' ongoing trade war with China. The Dow has erased its gains for the year, while the S&P 500 pulled back 2.3 percent to 2,633.08 and turned negative for the year.
